oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of Testing and Removal of Persistently Infected Bovine Viral Diarrhea Virus Feeder Calves on Morbidity and Mortality of Home Pen-associated Feeder Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stevens, E. T.
Thomson, D. U.
Lindberg, N. N.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: feeder calves
bovine viral diarrhea virus persistent infection
BVD PI
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Crossbred feeder calves (2,868 head 20 lots) were tested for bovine viral diarrhea virus persistent infection(BVD PI). The effects of testing and removal of persistently infected bovine viral diarrhea virus feeder calves on morbidity and mortality of home pen-associated feeder calves were determined.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2006; 307
